scenes.background: You are leading a project team that has just received an urgent assignment requiring a significant amount of work to be completed within a tight deadline. The team is feeling a lot of pressure, and morale is low, with some members showing signs of frustration and anxiety. One of the team members, Alex, said, 'This is impossible! We can't get this done in time.' You suggested taking a short break and coming back with a fresh perspective. [Monica] agreed, but [Bob] still seemed skeptical. After the break, [Bob] said, 'Even with a break, I don't see how we're going to manage this.' [Monica] added, 'Yeah, we need a better plan or more resources.' You acknowledged the team's concerns and suggested breaking down the tasks into smaller pieces and assigning them based on everyone's strengths. Now, [Monica] is looking over the task breakdown, and [Bob] is still frowning. You encouraged the team to stay focused and take a step-by-step approach. [Monica] seems a bit more optimistic, but [Bob] is still doubtful. [Bob] then said, 'Even with this step-by-step approach, it still feels overwhelming. What if we're just setting ourselves up for failure?' You encouraged the team to stay resilient and focus on what they can control. [Bob] is now pacing around, looking frustrated, while [Monica] is trying to stay positive.
scenes.description: [Bob] says, 'I still don't see how this is going to work. Maybe we should just tell the higher-ups it's not feasible.'

options.text: I understand, Bob. Let's discuss this together and see if we can find a way to make it more manageable.
options.analysis: You acknowledged Bob's concerns and proposed a collaborative discussion, demonstrating empathy and good social skills.

options.text: We've been through tough times before. Let's keep our heads down and focus on what we can achieve.
options.analysis: You encouraged the team to stay focused and resilient, showing good self-regulation and motivational skills.

options.text: If anyone feels strongly that this isn't going to work, we should consider voicing our concerns to management.
options.analysis: You suggested considering voicing concerns to management, showing good emotional perception and self-regulation.
